title: Piz Terri
text:
Piz Terri is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Lepontine%20Alps">Lepontine Alps</a>, located on the border between the cantons of <a href="Ticino">Ticino</a> and <a href="Graub%C3%BCnden">Graubünden</a>. At 3,149 metres above sea level it is the highest summit lying on the chain between <a href="Greina">Greina</a> and Soreda Pass. Piz Terri overlooks <a href="Lake%20Luzzone">Lake Luzzone</a> in Val Blenio on its west side, <a href="Val%20Sumvitg">Val Sumvitg</a> on its north side and <a href="Lumnezia">Lumnezia</a> on its east side. Close localities are <a href="Olivone">Olivone</a> (Val Blenio) and <a href="Vrin">Vrin</a> (Lumnezia).
The lake named "Laghet la Greina" (0.183 km²) is located not far from the summit, on the northwest side of the mountain, at an elevation of 2,585 metres. The faces are steep. Only a small glacier, named "Glatscher dil Terri", lies at the base of the north face. It previously extended down to the lake.
The summit can be reached by experienced hikers via a trail on the west ridge. The <a href="normal%20route">normal route</a> starts above Lake Luzzone at the Motterascio hut (2,171 metres), owned by the <a href="Swiss%20Alpine%20Club">Swiss Alpine Club</a>.
